name: .MPEG File Extension
summary: Learn about .MPEG files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An MPEG file is a video file saved in a digital video format standardized by the Moving Picture Experts Group (MPEG). It contains video and audio data compressed with MPEG-1 or MPEG-2 compression and is often used to share videos over the Internet.

content: MPEG is an international workgroup that sets standards for media compression and encoding. In 1993, MPEG created MPEG-1, the initial version of MPEG video and audio compression. Then, in 1995, MPEG released MPEG-1's successor, MPEG-2. Both MPEG-1 and MPEG-2 compression standards have been utilized in encoding video for over-the-air digital television broadcasts, DVDs, and home movies.
NOTE: MPEG files may also use the .MPG file extension and are now more commonly saved as .MP4 files, which utilize MPEG-4 compression.
